alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Norton (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 11:19PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Norton and eastern Decatur Counties through MIDNIGHT CDT... At 1118 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles west of Norton, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lenora and Edmond. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
